Definition.WordDefinition: Jason he that will cure, the host of Paul and Silas in Thessalonica. The Jews assaulted his house in order to seize Paul, but failing to find him, they dragged Jason before the ruler of the city (Acts 17:5-9). He was apparently one of the kinsmen of Paul (Rom. 16:21), and accompanied him from Thessalonica to Corinth.

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Jason \Jason\ prop. n. the husband of Medea and leader of the Argonauts who sailed in quest of the Golden Fleece. [WordNet 1.5]
Jason n : (Greek mythology) the husband of Medea and leader of the Argonauts who sailed in quest of the Golden Fleece
